0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Hypertension: 600 mg ORALLY once daily; range 400 to 800 mg ORALLY once daily or in 2 divided doses

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

2.title: Black Box Warning
2.mono:
Oral (Tablet)
Drugs that act on the renin-angiotensin system can cause injury or death to the developing fetus when used during the second and third trimesters. When pregnancy is confirmed, discontinue treatment immediately.

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• concomitant aliskiren use in diabetic patients
  • hypersensitivity to eprosartan or any components of the formulation

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Black Box Warning:
  • -- when pregnancy is detected, discontinue therapy immediately; risk of fetal toxicity
  • Cardiovascular:
  • -- symptomatic hypotension may occur in salt and/or volume depleted patients (eg, those receiving diuretics); correct depletion prior to initiating therapy or monitor closely
  • -- patients with severe congestive heart failure may have excessive hypotension or changes in renal function, such as oliguria, progressive azotemia, and, in rare cases, renal failure or death
  • Psychiatric:
  • --increases in serum lithium concentrations and lithium toxicity have been reported with concomitant use of lithium with angiotensin receptor agonists
  • Renal:
  • -- patients with unilateral or bilateral renal artery stenosis on ACE inhibitors and other angiotensin II antagonists may have increases in BUN or serum creatinine
  • --- deterioration of renal function, including renal failure, may occur in patients who are taking NSAIDs (including selective COX-2 inhibitors) with angiotensin 2 receptor agonists; monitoring recommended
  • Concomitant use:
  • -- avoid use with RAS inhibitors

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Eprosartan: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Eprosartan mesylate, a non-biphenyl non-tetrazole angiotensin II receptor (AT(1)) antagonist, prevents the binding of angiotensin II to AT(1) receptor. The blocking activity of eprosartan results in vasodilation and inhibition of aldosterone secretion..

0.title: Absorption
0.mono:
• Oral: time to peak concentration, 1 h to 2 h
  • Bioavailability: approximately 13%
  • Effect of food: none

3.title: Excretion
3.mono:
• Fecal:(IV), 61%
  • Fecal: (Oral), 90%
  • Renal: (IV), 37%
  • Renal: (Oral), 7% (approximately 20% as acyl glucuronide, 80% unchanged)
  • Dialyzable: no (hemodialysis), poorly removed

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
may be taken with or without food; take at the same time every day and consistently with respect to food intake

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• blood pressure, heart rate
  • renal function, electrolyte panel (eg; potassium, sodium)

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Patient should avoid activities requiring coordination until drug effects are realized, as drug may cause dizziness.
  • Instruct patient to rise slowly from a sitting/supine position, as drug may cause symptomatic hypotension.
  • This drug may cause abdominal pain, myalgia, upper respiratory infection, or fatigue.
  • Tell patient to maintain adequate hydration while taking this drug.
  • Patient may take with or without food, but drug should be taken at the same time each day and consistently with respect to food intake.
